generated.title: GeneratedTorsionalSpringConstant
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'TorsionalSpringConstant'

description*.en: A torsional spring constant is a measure of the stiffness of a torsional spring, which is a type of spring that experiences twisting or torque rather than compression or extension. It is typically measured in newton-meters per radian (N·m/rad) and is used to calculate the amount of torque required to twist a spring a certain amount. It is related to the spring's geometry, material properties, and manufacturing process. #,#Quotient Drehmoment zur elastischen Verformung einer Drehfeder durch den zugehörigen Drehwinkel

title: TorsionalSpringConstant
description: A torsional spring constant is a measure of the stiffness of a torsional spring, which is a type of spring that experiences twisting or torque rather than compression or extension. It is typically measured in newton-meters per radian (N·m/rad) and is used to calculate the amount of torque required to twist a spring a certain amount. It is related to the spring's geometry, material properties, and manufacturing process. #,#Quotient Drehmoment zur elastischen Verformung einer Drehfeder durch den zugehörigen Drehwinkel
